pullRequest.title: Updating issue and PR templates
pullRequest.bodyText:
I took drastic inspiration on the templates me and a friend wrote over here. No need to reinvent the wheel am I right. Give me feedback about them, I do have a certain... stlye :)
closes #3131 and a persistent voice in my head.

 I carefully read the contribution guidelines and agree to them.

commit.message: Merge branch 'templates' of https://github.com/Poolitzer/NewPipe into templates

nodes.bodyText:
Remove this code tag. The crash reporter has been done to be able to directly paste. If the TeamNewPipe wanted to have a code tag, they would have added it to the crash reporter.
See the difference

nodes.bodyText:
I'm not a native speaker and learnt at school we should use "for instance", "for example", or for the abbreviation e.g., and in my case not to use the frenc ex. (which stands for «exemple»).
Then was it false, or was it a mistake on your part?

+#### Is your feature request related to a problem? Please describe.
+A clear and concise description of what the problem is.
+Ex. *I want to do X, but there is no way to do it.*

nodes.bodyText:
We are at the end oh the template and I've not seen something:
A tick box if the PR is a bug fix, or a new feature
Also, you'll see below my comment on FR, but I think you should add a paragraph where people would rate how important / how painful for experience the bug is, so that contributors / maintainers focus on more important things

nodes.bodyText:
We are at the bottom of the template, and I disagree about "a clear and concise description" everywhere.
IMO, at least one paragraph should say:
Why you'd really want this feature? Explain how it will change your life and your NewPipe experience!
This was just an example, but the idea is to have one paragraph where people THINK about their request. Do they really WANT it, or it was just a thought they had but they don't really care about it.
And if they give good reasons why they really WANT it, we can understand better, and prioritize (dunno if it's how we say) these requests, or on the contrary, if they didn't give good reasons AND it seems like a niche request, maintaners / contributors will know there are more important things to fix / features to bring.
nodes.diffHunk:
@@ -0,0 +1,24 @@
+---
+name: Feature request
+about: Suggest an idea for this project
+title: "[Feature]"
+labels: enhancement
+assignees: ''
+
+---
+
+#### Is your feature request related to a problem? Please describe.
+A clear and concise description of what the problem is.
+Ex. *I want to do X, but there is no way to do it.*
+
+#### Describe the solution you'd like
+A clear and concise description of what you want to happen.
+Ex. *I think it would be nice if you would add feature Y so it will make it easier.*
+
+#### Describe alternatives you've considered
+A clear and concise description of any alternative solutions or features you've considered.
+Ex. *I considered Z, but that didn't work because...*
+
+#### Additional context
+Add any other context or screenshots about the feature request here.
+Ex. *Here's a photo of my cat!*

nodes.bodyText:
You didn't include a link to the contribution guidelines
Also, question to TeamNewpipe

Do not report crashes in the GitHub issue tracker. NewPipe has an automated crash report system that will ask you to send a report via e-mail when a crash occurs. This contains all the data we need for debugging, and allows you to even add a comment to it. You'll see exactly what is sent, the system is 100% transparent

You don't want people to just paste the crash report on GitHub because Sentry is better with automatization, but you are welcoming detailed report with steps to reproduce, further explaination… on GitHub, am I right?
Because if yes, this paragraph is not needed, by following the template people will give information. If no, we should write about that.

@@ -0,0 +1,40 @@
+---
+name: Bug report
+about: Create a bug report to help us improve
+title: "[BUG]"
+labels: bug
+assignees: ''
+
+---
+
+<!--
+Oh no, a bug. It happens. Thanks for reporting an issue with NewPipe
+
+Use this template to notify us if you found a bug.
+
+To make it easier for us to help you please enter detailed information below.
+
+Please note, we only support the latest version of NewPipe and
+master branch. Please make sure to upgrade & recreate the issue on the latest
+version prior to opening an issue. The release page (https://github.com/TeamNewPipe/NewPipe/releases/latest) is a good start, make sure its version is the same as in you app (To check you version, press on the three line menu on the left, click on "About", and you will see your current version.)
+-->
+### Steps to reproduce
+<!--If you cant reproduce it, please try and give as many details as possible how you think you got to the bug-->
+Steps to reproduce the behavior:
+1. Go to '...'
+2. Press on '....'
+3. Swipe down to '....'
+
+### Expected behavior
+Tell us what you expected to happen.
+
+### Actual behaviour
+Tell us what happens instead
+
+### Screenshots/-recording
+If applicable, add screenshots or a screen recording to help explain your problem. Github should support uploading them directly in the issue field. If your file is too big, feel free to paste a link from a image/video hoster here instead.
+
+### Logs
+If your bug includes a crash, please head over to the [incredible bugreport to markdown converter](https://teamnewpipe.github.io/CrashReportToMarkdown/). Copy the result. Paste it here:
+
+<!--Thats right, here-->

@@ -0,0 +1,29 @@
+---
+name: Feature request
+about: Suggest an idea for this project
+title: "[Feature]"
+labels: enhancement
+assignees: ''
+
+---
+
+#### Is your feature request related to a problem? Please describe.
+A clear and concise description of what the problem is.
+Ex. *I want to do X, but there is no way to do it.*
+
+#### Describe the solution you'd like
+A clear and concise description of what you want to happen.
+Ex. *I think it would be nice if you would add feature Y so it will make it easier.*
+
+#### Describe alternatives you've considered
+A clear and concise description of any alternative solutions or features you've considered.
+Ex. *I considered Z, but that didn't work because...*
+
+#### Additional context
+Add any other context or screenshots about the feature request here.
+Ex. *Here's a photo of my cat!*
+
+#### Why do you/everyone wants this feature
+Convince us! How does it change your NewPipe experience and/or your life?
+The better this paragraph is, the more likely a developer will think about developing it

nodes.diffHunk:
@@ -1 +1,23 @@
+<!-- Hey there. Thank you so much for improving our app. Please take a moment to fill out the following suggestion on how to structure this PR description. Having roughly the same layout drastically helps everybody :)-->

nodes.bodyText:
Perhaps we can include a unique (enough) ID or something so that issues sent to Sentry can be found more easily on demand (i.e., the reporter can post that ID, and the devs can find the relevant Sentry entry by searching for it).

Good idea. In this way, we could also add more valuable information like downloaded documents to the crash report.

I think we need to make a poll with the regular contributors asking them about their usage of Sentry. To me it doesn't seem overly well used.

The problem is that Sentry is too messy and searching logs in Sentry is quite difficult. We might also consider to not accept bugs from older versions.

commit.message:
NewPipe is an app though :(

And its our app!

Co-Authored-By: Tobias Groza <TobiGr@users.noreply.github.com>
adding version section to bug report
Merge branch 'templates' of https://github.com/Poolitzer/NewPipe into templates

nodes.bodyText:
Why is there a newline before this line? It should be removed

  
    
      
        Suggested change
        
          
    

        
      
    
    
      
          
            
            master branch. Please make sure to upgrade & recreate the issue on the latest version prior to opening an issue. The release page (https://github.com/TeamNewPipe/NewPipe/releases/latest) is a good start, make sure its version is the same as in you app (To check you version, press on the three line menu on the left, click on "About", and you will see your current version).

+#### Is your feature request related to a problem? Please describe.
+A clear and concise description of what the problem is.
+Example: *I want to do X, but there is no way to do it.*
+
+#### Describe the solution you'd like
+A clear and concise description of what you want to happen.
+Example: *I think it would be nice if you would add feature Y so it will make it easier.*
+
+#### Describe alternatives you've considered
+A clear and concise description of any alternative solutions or features you've considered.
